metadata.title: CVE-2023-6270 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - high
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the ATA over Ethernet (AoE) driver in the Linux kernel.The aoecmd_cfg_pkts() function improperly updates the refcnt on `structnet_device`, and a use-after-free can be triggered by racing between thefree on the struct and the access through the `skbtxq` global queue. Thiscould lead to a denial of service condition or potential code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6270` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.11.0-7-generic - 6.11.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-7-generic - 6.11.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-7-generic-64k - 6.11.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-aws - 6.11.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1003-azure - 6.11.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1001-gcp - 6.11.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-lowlatency - 6.11.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-lowlatency-64k - 6.11.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1004-oracle - 6.11.0-1004.4
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1004-oracle-64k - 6.11.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.11.0-1003-raspi - 6.11.0-1003.3
No subscription required
